metadata.Title: CVE-2022-1205 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A NULL pointer dereference flaw was found in the Linux kernelâ€™s Amateur Radio AX.25 protocol functionality in the way a user connects with the protocol. This flaw allows a local user to crash the system. Duoming Zhou discovered race conditions in the AX.25 amateur radio protocol implementation in the Linux kernel, leading to use-after-free vulnerabilities. A local attacker could possibly use this to cause a denial of service (system crash).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-1205` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-6.5.0-13-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic - 5.19.0-15.15
linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-13-generic-64k - 5.19.0-15.15
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1010-aws - 5.19.0-1005.5
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-6.5.0-1008-azure - 5.19.0-1004.4
No subscription required
